publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1996 Pauline McNeill: Yasser Arafat—That the Parliament extends its deepest condolences to the Palestinian people for the very sad loss of their leader, President Yasser Arafat, who retained popular and unified support across Palestinian communities for 30 years; believes that President Arafat should be remembered for making the world aware of the existence and the struggle of the Palestinians as a people displaced from their homeland, and further believes that the most lasting tribute to Yasser Arafat would be international effort to ensure a viable independent Palestinian state in the West Bank and Gaza Strip and to ensure the right of return of Palestinian refugees.

S2M-1996 Pauline McNeill: Yasser Arafat—That the Parliament extends its deepest condolences to the Palestinian people for the very sad loss of their leader, President Yasser Arafat, who retained popular and unified support across Palestinian communities for 30 years; believes that President Arafat should be remembered for making the world aware of the existence and the struggle of the Palestinians as a people displaced from their homeland, and further believes that the most lasting tribute to Yasser Arafat would be international effort to ensure a viable independent Palestinian state in the West Bank and Gaza Strip and to ensure the right of return of Palestinian refugees.

S2M-1996 Yasser Arafat (lodged on 11 November 2004) Jackie Baillie*, Chris Ballance*, Cathie Craigie*, Frances Curran*, Linda Fabiani*, Patrick Harvie*, Mr John Home Robertson*, Carolyn Leckie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Michael McMahon*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Alex Neil*, Eleanor Scott*, Elaine Smith*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Ms Sandra White*, Marlyn Glen*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Bill Butler*
S2M-1996 Yasser Arafat (lodged on 11 November 2004) Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-1996 Yasser Arafat (lodged on 11 November 2004) Mike Watson*, Scott Barrie*, Nora Radcliffe*, Rosie Kane*, Colin Fox*
S2M-1996 Yasser Arafat (lodged on 11 November 2004) Susan Deacon*
S2M-1996 Yasser Arafat (lodged on 11 November 2004) Cathy Peattie*
